title: IHC to hear appeals on June 5, seeking suspension of PTI founder, Bushra Bibiâ€™s sentences
content:
ISLAMABAD, May 29 (APP): A division bench of Islamabad High Court (IHC) would take up the appeals of PTI founder and Bushra Bibi for hearing on June 5, seeking suspension of their sentences in 190millions pound reference.
The registrar office of the high court had issued the cause list regarding scheduling of the case for hearing. A two-judge bench comprising Acting Chief Justice Sardar Sarfraz Dogar and Justice Muhammad Asif would hear the appeals.
PTI founder has approached the IHC and filed miscellaneous application for early hearing of the case, which was accepted by the court.
The trial court had announced imprisonment sentences to PTI founder and Bushra Bibi in corruption reference connected with the Al-Qadir Trust University.
